question.text: How will a police officer in a patrol vehicle normally get you to stop?

explanation.text: You must obey signals given by the police. If a police officer in a patrol vehicle wants you to pull over they will indicate this without causing danger to you or other traffic.

answer.text: Flash the headlights, indicate left and point to the left
Wait until you stop, then approach you
Use the siren, overtake, cut in front and stop
Pull alongside you, use the siren and wave you to stop
